review_title: Better than VR PLAYER for me
one_reviews_text: Sometimes i have to play very heavy videos like 5/10go, and VR PLAYER take 1hour to load them, with this player i have no problem it's pretty fast, ui is good, i dont understand all bad reviews i really think that this player is awesome

There are several video players out there I've tried for playing 3D digital movie files, the main reason I'd watch a movie in the headset. This has been the simplest to use so far; other programs I've tried have minor issues that prevent me from using them for one reason or another. It's free too...that's tough, if not impossible, to find even for my desktop 3D monitor. If you're having trouble, I suggest checking your settings.

I've tried several different video players and have settled on this one as the cream-of-the-crop.  I like that it handles subtitles and that they are placed off the viewing area.  I like that you can scale the video view as well.  Great implementation!!!

If I could change one thing, I'd *remove* the light icon that is off to the right of the virtual screen.  Not sure why that just isn't part of the off-screen options?  Make that minor tweak and it would be a perfect app.

Even after reinstall all I see is "Oops! Can't load the video". Looks like I force-quitted the app on wrong page.

It's high time programmers actually test their apps before release.
everyone thats said its bad its bc your pcs sucks

review_title: When i try to enter YouTube, i see this
one_reviews_text: This browser or app may not be secure
cant even watch a video without it moving my cursor
The player can't even play downloaded youtube's 360 videos. 8K also not supported.

The Desktop view has a feature that allows you to select files to play, but it seems to be activating at random, and I can reliably get it to play videos I don't want to watch, but not the ones I do want to watch. Even then, I am unable to select the proper audio track, as it only shows those that match the system locale.

In other words, completely unusable.

This is an online 360 video player.  I was actually looking for one to play local downloaded movies, that being said I did give it a try and thought I would write a review.

This app uses head movements to control the interface via a small dot on the screen, you move your head and the dot moves - that's how you point!!  I'm sure that's how things were done years ago in VR but things have moved on.  Its impossible to use when lying down, because the video controls require you to look further down than is possible.

I did get a pretty awesome snowboarding video which made me want to dig out my snowboard and book a holiday; this was the only good video I saw.   I tried several others which claimed to be 8K but the picture quality was so abysmal that you could barely see what it was supposed to be.

I'm giving the app 2 stars for the brilliant snowboarding video alone. But I will probably uninstall it now.

Hi. Infected by IDP.Generic malware according to Avast antivirus. I don't want to take the risk, I leave it in quarantine waiting for the developers to fix this issue if it is a false virus, false positive, don't know. I have never encountered this situation with other players.

the only problem i have found with this, which is very big, is that whenever i want to watch a video and NOT USE HANDS FREE MODE the app keeps switching my to hands free every couple of seconds and it is very annoying to have the yellow dot in the middle of the screen all the time.

review_title: BEST VIDEO PLAYER I HAVE FOUND
one_reviews_text:
Upon loading up you have a selection of Gizmo videos to watch which can take you a long time, it has the option to play video from your computer and also lets you browse video sites.

Other video programs when you try to browse other video sites it always returns errors this works fine, recommended its easy to use and works brilliantly by using your headset as a pointer together with xbox controller

Says it supports Oculus Touch but the only way you can move your pointer is with head tracking.

Has a bizzare "Import Video" feature where you cannot play a video off your disk without "importing" it first.  It does let you import a whole directory but you must be wearing the headset to do that.  You cannot "import all" and take the headset off, it will pause the import process.
it is very good

review_title: One of the worst video players ever
one_reviews_text: Who in the world decided that a 'hand free' option that AUTOMATICALLY ENABLES ITSELF IF YOU DON'T MOVE YOUR TOUCH CONTROLLER FOR 10 SECONDS are a good idea? Horrible! Super glad it's free because it would have never been worth even a cent!

One of the best video players around but they just can't seem to get the controls working properly at all. With the latest update my xbox 1 controller doesn't work with it anymore, nor does my keyboard. Only the touch controllers which I dont like using for  media consumption. Please fix this devs!!!

Update: With the latest updates the devs have fixed the controls and the application is now smooth as silk!
nothing more to say
Says "playback from youtube" as a feature, but as far as I can tell it can't play VR videos from youtube.

Best player ive tried so far, would be almost perfect except for occasional crashes = screen goes black while video keeps playing. Sometimes its enough to restart the app, sometimes i have to restart occulus. Happens maybe 2 times/hour.

3D mode looks great for good quality videos, i wish the browser showed longer file names instead of something like "Video ... VR".
how to install

As noted by other viewers, I've used this in the past without issue. I updated the app from the oculus launcher and then tried to run it - it wasn't working, so I tabbed out. Avast had flagged it as IDP.Generic. I closed it and tried to reinstall with oculus, because I figured it was a false alarm. It didn't work, because the executable could no longer be deleted - even by the only admin account on the computer - to reinstall. I got rid of it and reloaded my operating system.

I can only speculate as to whether this is intentional by the developers, but I don't recommend this app.
On the off-hand, great Quality Control @Oculus

Just after this last update, my virus software flags this player's browser plugin as having Malware.  I've liked using this player in the past, but am halting it's use until I do more research.  Alternately, I'd like to revert back the previous version I had which didn't trigger my anti-virus software.  The problem is that I can't find a way to do that in the Oculus Store or Gizmo VR's website.  I can do that with Steam but I don't want to use the Steam version since Steams VR software is more buggy in my experience.
I'm still researching this and will update this review if/when I learn more!
BE CAREFUL!

I like it

I tried several cinema apps and experienced one frustration after the other because of the massive lack of intuitive control and consequent unability to recognize different video formats and play them just like they should be played. Where none of the tested Apps could do, Gizmo can!
I easily found my videos on hd within few seconds. Without adjusting any preferences Gizmo played them. No necessity to rename files with suffixes like sbs, 3D, ou, 180 or anything else.
Perfect for me and easy to use.
Compared to other apps Gizmo loves its audience and tries with success to give them a convenient reception of their own movies. No need to browse internet for hours just to find a nonexistant app manual.
Thanks Gizmo! ;-)

I was trying to find a way to watch 360 Youtube videos, and for whatever reason the youtube app on the steam store locks everything to 1080p so the videos don't look great.  I found this, and you can watch them in any supported resolution and they look much better.

I also like this app because you can queue up videos or launch them from outside VR.  I use this when I'm showing family and friends VR so I don't have to explain to them how to find the video I want them to see.  The AirPano stuff looks incredible on here.
